newsitem.title: THAILAND: RESEARCH ALERT-Advanced Info rated buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Advanced Info rated buy.

text.p: Asia Equity said on Wednesday it rated Advanced Info Service Plc a buy despite an anaemic earning growth forecast for the company for 1997.
Asia Equity said Advanced Info has a strong long-term competitive advantage from its current heavy network expansion.

Asia Equity said Advanced Info was a good bargain as it was being traded at historical low price/earning ratio of 9.8 times projected 1997 earnings and 8.8 times prospective 1998 earnings, Asia Equity said.
"It is currently the least expensive blue-chip (telecommunication stock)," Asia Equity said in a report.
Advanced Info is a part of telecommunicaton giant Shinawatra Group. The Shinawatra Group is involved in numerous businesses, including computers, telecommunications and broadcasting.
The company's principle activities are providing services for cellular telephones, paging and voice/data transmission.

Asia Equity said concern over the prospect of increased competition, especially in 1900 MHz cellular phone, was unjustified as Advanced Info already has a considerable lead in terms of time, technology and subscriber base.
"Potential new competitors at 1900 MHz will face considerable competitive disadvantages," Asia Equity said.
"A nationwide network would cost in excess of US$700 million and would need more than 600,000 subscribers (at current revenue per subscriber) to break even," it added.
Asia Equity forecast Advanced Info's net profit at 3.77 billion baht ($145 million) in 1997, 4.19 billion in 1998, and 5.38 billion in 1999. ($1 = 26 baht)
